title: About
text: Hello my name is Jackson. I am a Sports Media and Communications major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I love sports and college basketball is my favorite thing on the planet.

title: Passing the Torch: How Jon Scheyer Is Sustaining Duke’s Standard
text:
Coaching transitions at blue-blood programs rarely go smoothly. When Mike Krzyzewski stepped away in 2022, Duke faced the same uncertainty that often derails historic programs, but Jon Scheyer has defied that trend.
Instead of a drop-off, Duke has remained one of college basketball’s most consistent winners. The numbers show why.


Code
duke <- duke |>
  mutate(
    Season = as.numeric(substr(year, 1, 4)),
    WinPct = as.numeric(`W.L.`),
    Coach = recode(Coach,
                   "Krzyzewski" = "Coach K",
                   "Mike Krzyzewski" = "Coach K",
                   "Jon Scheyer" = "Jon Scheyer")
  )




Code
ggplot(duke, aes(x = Season, y = WinPct, color = Coach, group = Coach)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1.5) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("Coach K" = "blue", "Jon Scheyer" = "black")) +
  annotate("text",
           x = 2022.2,
           y = 0.92,
           label = "Coach K retires",
           size = 3) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2022, linetype = "dashed", color = "grey") +
  labs(
    title = "Scheyer has kept Duke in the same winning range as Coach K",
    subtitle = "Despite replacing a legend, Duke’s win percentage under Scheyer mirrors late-era Coach K seasons.",
    x = "Season",
    y = "Win Percentage",
    caption = "Source: Duke Athletics | Graphic by Jackson Knust"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 9),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )
